content.raw:
perfect, and yep, the situation with the branches is ideal here.

What's not ideal is a [pending bitbucket bug](https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/14116/mercurial-cross-fork-pullrequests-dont) that doesn't let me close the branch upon merging from bitbucket.

So I pulled from you to my local machine, and did the "close branch" commit and merged there before pushing to the main repo - that automatically marked this pull request as merged. So all seems to be well.
content.html:
perfect, and yep, the situation with the branches is ideal here.

What's not ideal is a pending bitbucket bug that doesn't let me close the branch upon merging from bitbucket.

So I pulled from you to my local machine, and did the "close branch" commit and merged there before pushing to the main repo - that automatically marked this pull request as merged. So all seems to be well.
